definition: to turn up without being invited/unsolicited
(negative prefix)/not/no
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Ask workers to help pick up unsolicited flyers left on your doorstep.
sentences.chinese: 請工人們幫忙撿起門口階梯上不請自來的傳單。

sentences.english: Both friendship and material benefits may well come to you at this time.
sentences.chinese: 友誼和物質利益可能會同時不請自來喲。

sentences.english: Many of those who joined in it, uninvited, we did not even know.
sentences.chinese: 許多不請自來的參加者，我們連認都不認得。

sentences.english: You can worry about their manners at showing up uninvited later.
sentences.chinese: 你可以過會兒再爲他們不請自來的行爲操心。

sentences.english: Tom crashed the gate and ate like a horse.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆不請自來，擅自闖進來大喫一餐。

sentences.english: Man A: Aren't you worried it might get gatecrashed?
sentences.chinese: 會擔心有人不請自來嗎？

sentences.english: Then love may come unasked, when you are not seeking it.
sentences.chinese: 那樣，當你停止追尋時，愛也許會不請自來。

sentences.english: Here the actor is the intruder.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏，演員去不請自來。

sentences.english: Then she's inviting herself to dinner three times a week.
sentences.chinese: 然後就是一週三次不請自來地蹭飯。

definition: lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
pinyin: nan2 nu:3 shou4 shou4 bu4 qin1

definition: foolish talk/nonsense
to make a fool of oneself
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: nodding acquaintance
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
fate is unfavorable (idiom); the omens are not good
to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
tearful/brimming with tears
glib of tongue (idiom)/eloquent
female gossip/busybody
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
